newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil needs 1.5 pct primary surplus - Malan.
newsitem.headline: Brazil needs 1.5 pct primary surplus - Malan.

text.p: Brazilian Finance Pedro Malan said Thursday Brazil needed to generate a primary surplus of 1.5 percent of gross domestic product to halt the growth in internal debt and that he was sure it could be achieved.

Malan told national CBN radio it was also necessary to push on with administrative and pension reforms, currently languishing in Congress while all attention is focused on October 3 municipal elections.
"Two things must be done," he said in response to a question about the rapid growth of Brazil's internal debt.
"We must generate a primary surplus which I think has to be about 1.5 percent, at least 1.5 percent of GDP. I think it's possible," he said.
Malan said the second thing to do was push on with the fiscal reforms.

Sending a message to congressmen who have criticized the government's accumulation of debt, he said: "Those who say they are concerned about the rising level of debt should be doing their utmost to push the reforms through Congress."
